title: 111_s1669
content: The Act titled "Equal Access to Medicare Options Act of 2009" guarantees issue of Medigap policies to all Medicare beneficiaries. The Act "Equal Access to Medicare Options Act of 2009" ensures that all Medicare beneficiaries are entitled to or enrolled for benefits under part A and enrolled for benefits under part B. The Secretary of Health and Human Services has the authority to phase in the implementation of these amendments to minimize any adverse impact on individuals with Medicare supplemental policies. The Act "Equal Access to Medicare Options Act of 2009" establishes a phase-in period not exceeding 5 years for Medicare supplemental policy amendments. Individuals enrolled prior to January 1, 2015, will be classified in a separate premium class. A one-time enrollment period will be established for certain individuals to enroll in Medicare. Individuals eligible for Medicare can enroll in any supplemental policy of their choice within a specific enrollment period. This period starts after the phase-in period ends and lasts for six months. Eligible individuals must have hospital insurance benefits under part A, be enrolled in part B benefits, and would not be eligible without the provisions of the Act. The Secretary will develop an outreach plan to notify eligible individuals of the one-time enrollment period for Medicare supplemental policies. SEC. 3. Guaranteed issue of Medigap policies for Medicare Advantage and Medicaid enrollees. Section 1882(s)(3) of the Social Security Act is amended to include new clauses regarding enrollment in Medicare Advantage plans and eligibility for benefits under parts A and B. The Social Security Act is amended to include new clauses related to enrollment in Medicare Advantage plans and eligibility for benefits under parts A and B, including changes to Medicare supplemental policies. The Social Security Act is amended to include new clauses related to enrollment in Medicare Advantage plans and eligibility for benefits under parts A and B, including changes to Medicare supplemental policies effective on or after January 1, 2010. SEC. 4. ENROLLMENT OF INDIVIDUALS WITH END STAGE RENAL DISEASE IN MEDICARE ADVANTAGE. Section 1851(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to define a 'Medicare+Choice eligible individual' as someone entitled to benefits under part A and enrolled under part B. Additionally, Section 1852(b) is amended to prohibit Medicare+Choice organizations from denying coverage based on health status-related factors. The Secretary will not approve a plan if it is likely to discourage enrollment by certain MA eligible individuals. Amendments to Section 1859(b)(6)(B) allow for exceptions in certain cases. These changes will apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 2010.
